entries.text:
# Make a Diary of my coding efforts?

See if making diary of my coding efforts helps me write more code, better code or even, ideally, help me write code regularly \.

networkx \- 

discovered how to pickle and unpickle objects 
https://www\.datacamp\.com/community/tutorials/pickle\-python\-tutorial#what
I might rewrite the data back in JSON
https://www\.datacamp\.com/community/tutorials/json\-data\-python

Twitter data for today was probably from this place 
http://konect\.cc/networks/twitter\_mpi/

entries.text:
# An afternoon NetworkX\-ing

Spent my afternoon diving deeper into `networkx` I wasnâ€™t really doing anything, just wasting my time\.

Got to understand how the layout engine work\.  It's kind a cool\.  

![](dayone-moment://5047168318004814B2F70B1ABF3B2490)

![](dayone-moment://5E9890188EEA45E88F726FE1DE87AE15)

![](dayone-moment://4EF0C434EEF34699B69233A466B0E78D)

## Fish & Chips ðŸŸðŸŸ
Dinner was Fish and Chips from our favourite Marina Fish bar on the London Road just opposite the Nelson Pub\. Interesting to think that the Turkish owners are upholding a British traditional food\.  The staff are living their lives in the UK as Londoners with a Turkish identity\.  Wonder when we will see an Australian being a sushi chef in Japan?

entries.text:
# helping Hannah with networkx

Hannahâ€™s Delivery Route Optimiser still needs a lot of work\. I realise that unless Iâ€™ve done the work before hand sheâ€™s really not going to be able to do the task\.

Today I set about recreating her simple case â€˜shortest pathâ€™ example in Jupyter\.

### Little reflection
The quick and dirty demo code could calculate the shortest path and show that path on a graph\. But the layout of the nodes would be counter intuitive  

![](dayone-moment://7AEF6502D73A487C908CA4010550FC36)

I could force the node location  by manually defining the `pos` parameter or allow a generator to do the layout for me\.

Iâ€™m reminded there are many [graph generators ](https://networkx.org/documentation/stable/reference/generators.html)to get you started \- below I fiddle around with the multipartite generator\.
### References
How to force node positions while plotting
How to pass  many parameters in a tidy way  
At the NetworkX\.org/documentation \-\-> [HERE ](https://networkx.org/documentation/latest/auto_examples/basic/plot_simple_graph.html#sphx-glr-auto-examples-basic-plot-simple-graph-py)




### Below is a â€˜completeâ€™ multi partite graph\.

![](dayone-moment://B8E4E15DD1514B7F8E11B9BE77F4F42B)

# PIP vs CONDA

Todayâ€™s nerdy coding activity
Frustrated I couldnâ€™t get some demo code working I got confused between PIP and CONDA for installing python libaries\.

The two have similar but slightly distinct functions

This explained it all 
https://www\.anaconda\.com/blog/understanding\-conda\-and\-pip

I needed to understand pip vs conda to get Google Maps in Python working aka GMPLOT\.  Nice Medium\.com article which explains a little more \-> [HERE](https://medium.com/@stevenvandorpe/gmplot-in-jupyter-installation-guide-and-package-exploration-338756e8f26)

Looks like I will need to register with a pay\-for google developer account

https://developers\.google\.com/maps/documentation/embed/get\-api\-key

My Google Developer API Key
`AIzaSyD8NKcbapxU2vRZVg1oOIwlit37jcHqrR8`

entries.text:
# Coding breakthrough 

Remembering how to manipulate DICTs LISTs in python was painful but paid some dividends yesterday\. I can now read the JSON export files from Imiwa and filter them into a new Inky wHat friendly format\. 

I feel quite proud of my progress :\-\)

![](dayone-moment://E9AAF3D600624208B7A63E19BEB78206)
